Reviews.Title: “A Place Where You Can't Sleep At Night”
Reviews.Author: Biho13
Reviews.Content: I was just in Dubai to attend an exhibition there. I booked in Dubai Palm Hotel to spend my 3 nights. The hotel rooms and stuff are not bad they were average. The terrible thing that turned our stay to hell is the night clubs they have. They have I think more than 3 night clubs with more than 3 parts every night. The sound is very HORRIBLE and very loud to the extent that you can't relax, sleep or even do any thing form it. Our stay was BB. The breakfast is very very poor only 4 types of food. It wasn't a good experience to go there. I won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok for a Stop over”
Reviews.Author: daudratul
Reviews.Content: had the opportunity to stay in this big but "OK" hotel as a stop over in Dubai. Staffs are friendly, rooms are ok and the food is OK too (unusual for a hotel in Dubai). The rooms were bit old fashioned again unusual for Dubai. The location is great. Very close to the city center. The toilets are bit faded out and gloomy. I won't recommend for any reason except for a stop over. 1 night sleep at an affordable price. For family members, be aware of this hotel and the locality. You may not like if you are travelling with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Different place, Good for staying , But.............!”
Reviews.Author: babakIran
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days and this was 8th time of my stay in dubai.I can explain here acceptable when you consider price. Most of the time I chose some place near city cener or Reghe. Therefore because I tried different location was fantastic. This location is very good place with good acess to shoopings and resturants. At first , the reception give my room 2 hours before chech in time and also upgrade my room from triple to swit free charge and therefore , it was warm welcome! the receptionist was not friendly , but she is informative and serious. About roon they are clean and acceptable but they are not luxurious. The lunch and breakfast was delicious but not variable. But the worst thing about this palce is no acsess to internet. Can you consider a place without internet in 21 century! in ground floor there are some discoo , therefore it is better to choose the third or fourth floor to stay , because of sound at night. in a nut shell I will return here!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, ok rooms and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: alensandler
Reviews.Content: the staff were friendly, the area is close to the center and the staff were pretty friendly. The food was not great but good enough for the price. the rooms were basic but for the price it was not bad. the only thing i would suggest if you are a family be careful because there are a lot of prostitutes which doesn't look great for kids. otherwise not a bad hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: trandyloner
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the Hotel was in a prime location but the facilities and service is not at all good..... There are several bars on-site and makes me feel unsafe in the place. The smell in the corridors as well as in the room is terribble. To my surpirse, the Breakfast was aweful.... only boiled eggs and sausages with French Toast, no other viands... additionally, the venue is not conjusive for an early breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Luckyblessed
Reviews.Content: I was one of the most unfortunate persons to stay in this hotel. A flock of hookers rushed to me and offered their ‘services’. Counter boy (Neeraj) and other Bengali staff were good; else it was a nightmare to stay over there. I booked the room through a booking website, but hotel owner insisted to pay 75 AED = US$ 20 (extra), I had no other option but to pay. As many as 7 night clubs don’t let you sleep until it struck 03:00 AM. Breakfast was disgusting and I won’t take it even if it is offered free. I was amazed to see owners of the hotel (Mr. Meesam & Mr. Muhammad) checking ‘breakfast tokens’ in a very rough manner. Isn’t this an insult of the guests? Parking is offered ‘free’, but you will have to pay AED 25/night, while getting ur car back, At the ground floor, is an Indian restaurant (Kalpaka Vadi), don’t step in there, Food is worse and prices are high. Rooms are bad, with old carpets. I did call at the reception so many times to clean the bath room and provide soap and towel but it was all in vain. TV had only 8 channels. You will have to change the channels manually or buy battery cells for the remote to bring it operational (as I did).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: tirdadkia
Reviews.Content: just terrible you can not sleep until 2 am when bars are clossed because of load noise, spilliters leak water to the curtain and made it dirty , trust me do not test it

Reviews.Title: “will you be happy to awake to staff in your room at 2am when asleep children?”
Reviews.Author: janiceanddan
Reviews.Content: no mistaking room here just mistake that daughter was disturbed and awoke to find staff member in room-he fled -hotel comment i know you will forgive it was mistake-MISTAKE YOU HAVING A LAUGH !! Ladies no way go here !! Lucky kids not woken !! And ladies not in good area very rough and very dodgy characters on street .Hotel basic ,smelly and pool area being dug up.Forget Dubai in summer and Ramadan believe me nothing pleasant about the experience-definetely wont be back even if win lotto

Reviews.Title: “Shopping Aligned!”
Reviews.Author: PD33
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel is terms of location. Good restaurants particularly vegetarian ones are nearby and so is the airport. The main malls and markets are not far. Rooms a bit smelly though and a few nightclubs are inside to hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth at all, don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Saeed_Masoudi
Reviews.Content: It was a bad enough; me and my friends had a bad staying there. Everything was in very low quality. It is not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there again if only is FREE!!!”
Reviews.Author: KamiliaTehran
Reviews.Content: I have not seen all 3star hotels in Dubai, but I am definitely sure that Dubai Palm is one of the worst one in Dubai, perhaps in the world. All rooms are net and damn. Foods are awful. Every day the same food again and again. Shower is not good. Staff, especially receptionists, a Pilipino woman in morning and an Indian boy in evening, are the ruddiest one that I have ever seen. Very rude and angry really. Furniture are so old and dirty. Never go again even if it is FREE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two Palm Hotels - avoid the one with Irish bar in it”
Reviews.Author: HillsRTW2007
Reviews.Content: There are two Palm Hotels in Dubai. The one I nearly stayed in has an Irish pub and is next to the Hard Rock. I arrived early and my room (booked for the previous night due to early arrival) wasn't ready. The breakfast was ok at best but wouldn't choose it. On entering my room there was damp on the walls. All I wanted was a shower ofter my flight but the bathroom had algae around the bath. I didn't stay and don't recommend you book it either.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as all made out”
Reviews.Author: industrial-gypsie
Reviews.Content: This hotel by no means the best in the world is certainly ok. The staff are friendly and courteous and service is farily quick. The food is nothing special but then again the price is reasonable. The only food complaint is the scrambled egg more like liquidised than scrambled. stayed for over week my colleagues for nearly a month so not so bad as evryone made out

Reviews.Title: “It's terrible.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyTwickenham
Reviews.Content: On arrival the room wasn't available. Thankfully it was on the third floor, which was supposed to be quieter when the disco started @ 9pm until 3am. For the whole of my 7 day visit I probably only got 17 hours sleep. The call to prayer starts @ 05.45 and if that didn't wake me, the cleaner would start hoovering the hall way anytime after 4.30am !! The toilet leaked over the bathroom floor for all of the period of my stay and anytime I mentioned anything that was wrong at Reception, I was told that this was the Dubai Palm experience. No wonder the taxis driver, when he was taking me there from the airport, asked if I had booked...............

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Waste Your $$ Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Gertrude_Bell
Reviews.Content: March 2007 ABSOLUTELY AWFUL...noisy, dirty, falling apart. Scary breakfast. We are both sound sleepers but were a bit worried about the noisy a/c. That turned out to be a bonus because at 11 pm when the disco came to life--the whole building shook and the a/c sort of drowned out the bump/grind music! It was about $75/night for a double (actually 2 singles, though that's not what we requested). Unfortunately, in Dubai & Abu Dhabi, all the medium-priced (3 star) hotels are being refurbished & made into 5 star hotels. So finding a room at a reasonable cost is getting more & more difficult. So you're left w/ total slimepits like the DPH, which are -10 stars, but can charge like a 2-3 star hotel because there's NO WHERE ELSE TO GO. Please someone build some Holiday Inn or Motel 6s here!

Reviews.Title: “Hated Hated Hated”
Reviews.Author: uvsingh
Reviews.Content: rude staff, stinking bathroom, dirty carperts, construction noise, aweful breakfast, sleazy looking people all around.. the worst hotel i ever statyed in.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: REBMAT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel I have stayed in. It has apparently 3 stars. It is not worthy of one. The first room I had did not have wardrobe doors hinged onto it. They were freestanding. They were placed by the wardrobe. I was then transferred to the "right" room. I would describe it as "mutton dressed as lamb". The bathroom was disgusting, mould growing from the shower curtain, no hot or cold water, merely tepid, though slightly warmer from the cold tap. To have a shower you needed to get into the bath. The bath did not feel secure as I sank into it once standing. The carpet was stained badly as were the walls outside the room. I had the "pleasure" of being in the night club i.e. trying to sleep at 2a.m. with the vibrating music below. The breakfast was eaten in the nightclub area. I do not expect to have milk offered for tea and coffee out of a tin. Or to have bread coming out of a plastic bag, like the Tesco cheap range. Very distasteful. The porters were friendly and worked very hard. The reception staff were surly and abrupt. I felt I had to fight to get attention. My message is that if you read this review I would suggest that you do not go to this hotel. You will be very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sicillian
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotelapprox 10pm at night due to a business trip. Upon arrival i was highly disappointed as the recption area was full of men looking fairly sleazy. Not a pleasant sight for a woman travelling alone. As i checked in i was told that they would hold onto my passport until checking out. On the way to my room without any assistance there were at least 4 men watching my every move. I hoped my room would be better and lift my spirits- well think again! The room smelt of damp, the floor was wet near the bathroom, the bathroom door would not open fully or even close fully, the room was dark, the sheets appeared to be unwashed. To think they claim in their brochure they have just remodernished the hotel. It was so bad i slept fully clothed. I hoped the following morning things would improve and i was finding faults because i was just tired. I went down to breakfast as it was included in the booking. To my dismay it was jst as bad as the room! No continental breakfast, the milk tasted off and the only thing edible was a slice of toast. The surrounding tables were uncleared due to the previous diners and the only other remaing diners were men. All 12 of them!! So upset i left the breakfast room that was a disco by night i waldked along the corridor faced with a barrage of matresses and building work going on. To make it worst ,as i am a non muslim, it was Ramadan so i couldn't even eat out. I had enough and checked out immediately only then to be told i couldn't used my credit card. They didn't want to pay the charges for the credit card machines. Not a good start to my business trip. Well i'm glad to say to my next hotel, of my choice, was a lot better and safer! Take my advice save your money and stay clear of this hotel. Its disappointing and does Dubai itself no favours. Mrs G.Gayle, London

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: FightingForMyRights
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews on this website before booking the hotel in Dubai. I arrived at around 12midnight and was given a room on the first floor. The minute I realised that I was in for a noisy sleepless night I requested them to move me to another room, but apparently all single rooms were full and the best they could do was offer me a triple room on the condition that I vacate it at 3am when the nightclub shut. What kind of service is that? The rooms are dingy and not cleaned properly - I moved rooms every single night of my 3 night stay there! The TV reception is rubbish, so there are very few channels that you can actually watch. Breakfast is served in the gloomy windowless room that serves as the nightclub at night. I was never informed about the free shuttle service - instead the reception staff were more keen to sell me tours, even at 12 midnight when I have just arrived after a long tiring flight! The rooms were NOT value for money. Even 2 star hotels in UK have better service than that rubbish place in Dubai. And the travel agent that I booked the hotel through (Air Travel Corporation aka TravelDubai.co.uk among other names) refuse to give me any compensation. I have checked out this hotel on different websites, and not one hotel website mentions a nightclub! I think travel agents are a bunch of misleading rip off artists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived back from the Dubai Palm Hotel and after reading the 2 past reviews, went there equipped with "flash wipes" and our own towels. Well, we needn't have bothered. The hotel was very clean and tidy, the staff were excellent and friendly - nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms and facilities were exactly as described on their website [--]. When asked, they let us know of all the trips on offer and were very helpful. We vaguely heard the discos and our room was on the 2nd floor. The buffet breakfast was adequate. I would recommend this hotel and would consider staying there again on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Why the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: sheila1234
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palm Hotel in Dubai and arrived there with misgivings, having read the dire reports in Tripadvisor. We need'nt have worried: the room was clean,(sheets/towels changed daily), spacious with all you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Nobody mentioned the free daily bus service to beach and city centre. And the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The only downside was the incessant noise from aircraft flying over, day and night - hardly the fault of the Hotel. There was some noise from the disco but if you ask for a quiet room its not so bad. All in all a great holiday. My husband and I are both pensioners and have always believed that you get what you pay for - which was more than justified in the case of the Palm Hotel. A great break on our way home from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeze sleeze sleeze”
Reviews.Author: lucyjames
Reviews.Content: What a disgrace this hotel is. Not worthy of the 3 stars it has. Very sleezy (but you may like that type of thing!) Unable to sleep due to the 3 Disco's on the 1st floor 9pm until 3am every night. Breakfast then served in the Disco that has not had any fresh air in for years! If you arrive in this hotel - Big MISTAKE - move hotels or fly home early! We moved to the Hotel Riviara - FANTASTIC

HotelInfo.Name: Dubai Palm Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Muteena Street | PO Box 21969 Deira, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
